h1. FutureTask Example
h2. Summary
This example demonstrates using a FutureTask to send a message from a Producer app to a Consumer app, and demonstrates the asynchronous nature of a FutureTask working across more than one physical JVM using Terracotta.
The first node to start will listen for FutureTask objects, and execute them when received. Subsequent nodes will create a new FutureTask, push it into the queue, then wait for it's execution to complete and print the result of the execution.
h2. How to run
*Node 1:* {code} $ javac *.java $ start-tc-server & $ dso-java Main Waiting... (after starting other node...) Mon Mar 17 17:53:45 PDT 2008: Sleeping 2 seconds... Hello world {code}
*Node 2:* {code} $ dso-java Main Submitting task... Waiting for response... (after other node completes...) Task completed at: Mon Mar 17 17:53:47 PDT 2008 {code}
